intro: Jobaphes, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Its leaves are broad and oval, often with a hairy texture to reduce water loss. Jobaphes is well adapted to hot, dry climates and is often used in traditional medicine.
